# Arpeggio: add4 in G

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played individually in a sequence to create a flowing and melodic sound. The add4 arpeggio is a variation that includes the fourth note in the scale in addition to the standard chord tones. In this reference, we will explore the add4 arpeggio in the key of G.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals

The G add4 arpeggio in the key of G major includes the following notes: G (root), B (major third), D (perfect fifth), and C (add4). The intervals between these notes are as follows:
- G to B (Major 3rd)
- B to D (Perfect 5th)
- D to C (Add4)

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The add4 arpeggio in G is often used in genres such as pop, rock, and acoustic music to add a touch of color and tension to chord progressions. This arpeggio creates a dreamy and atmospheric sound due to the inclusion of the fourth note, which adds a sense of ambiguity and interest to the standard major chord.

## Examples in Songs

Here are three songs that use the G add4 arpeggio:
1. **"Yellow" by Coldplay**: The intro of this song features a G add4 arpeggio played on guitar, adding a beautiful and introspective texture to the music.
2. **"I Will Follow You Into The Dark" by Death Cab for Cutie**: This song uses the G add4 arpeggio in the chorus, enhancing the emotional depth of the lyrics.
3. **"Landslide" by Fleetwood Mac**: The guitar picking pattern in this classic song incorporates the G add4 arpeggio, contributing to its heartfelt and intimate vibe.

By understanding and incorporating the G add4 arpeggio into your musical repertoire, you can add a new dimension to your playing and composition in various musical settings.
